Class InputStreamLineBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • accessories.InputStreamLineBuffer

  • public class InputStreamLineBuffer
extends java.lang.Object

    InputStreamLineBuffer.class

    Input buffer that catches and stores the output from the executable process.

    Author:
    Sourish Banerjee

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      InputStreamLineBuffer(java.io.InputStream is)
      To initialize the input stream line buffer.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getNext()
      To obtain the next line of output from the input stream line buffer.
      boolean hasNext()
      To check whether the input stream line buffer has any more lines of output.
      boolean isAlive()
      To check whether the buffer is active or not.
      void start()
      To start the input stream line buffer.
      long timeElapsed()
      To return the amount of time elapsed since the last line of output was read from the executable process.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • InputStreamLineBuffer

        public InputStreamLineBuffer(java.io.InputStream is)
        To initialize the input stream line buffer.
        Parameters:
        is - Input stream upon which the input stream line buffer is built.

    • Method Detail

      • isAlive

        public boolean isAlive()
        To check whether the buffer is active or not.
        Returns:
        Boolean value indicating whether the buffer is active or not.

      • start

        public void start()
        To start the input stream line buffer. Starts the input catcher thread which reads output from the executable process and feeds it into the input stream line buffer.

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()
        To check whether the input stream line buffer has any more lines of output.
        Returns:
        Boolean value indicating whether the input stream line buffer has any more lines of output or not.

      • getNext

        public java.lang.String getNext()
        To obtain the next line of output from the input stream line buffer.
        Returns:
        The next line of output from the input stream line buffer.

      • timeElapsed

        public long timeElapsed()
        To return the amount of time elapsed since the last line of output was read from the executable process.
        Returns:
        The amount of time elapsed since the last line was read form the executable process.
